sections.title: Investigator (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Investigator class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators are proficient with simple weapons plus hand crossbow, rapier, sap, shortbow, short sword, and sword cane, as well as light armor but not shields.

sections.title: Alchemy (Su) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators create magical extracts like alchemists, gain bonuses to Craft (alchemy) checks, and can identify potions using Craft (alchemy).

sections.title: Inspiration (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators can spend inspiration points to add 1d6 to skill checks, ability checks, attack rolls (2 uses), and saving throws (2 uses), with free use on trained Knowledge, Linguistics, and Spellcraft.

sections.title: Trapfinding (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators add half their level to Perception checks for locating traps and Disable Device checks, and can disarm magical traps.

sections.title: Poison Lore (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators cannot accidentally poison themselves when applying poison, can identify poisons with Knowledge checks, and can neutralize poisons with Craft (alchemy).

sections.title: Poison Resistance (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators gain increasing bonuses on poison saves (+2 at 2nd, +4 at 5th, +6 at 8th) and complete poison immunity at 11th level.

sections.title: Investigator Talent (Ex) or (Su) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators gain special talents every 2 levels starting at 3rd level, with some talents marked with asterisks affecting studied combat or studied strike.

sections.title: Keen Recollection (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators can attempt all Knowledge skill checks untrained, representing their broad understanding and quick recall.

sections.title: Trap Sense (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators gain increasing bonuses to Reflex saves against traps and dodge bonuses to AC against trap attacks, starting at +1 and increasing every 3 levels.

sections.title: Studied Combat (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators can use a move action to study an enemy, gaining insight bonuses to attack and damage rolls against that target for rounds equal to Intelligence modifier.

sections.title: Studied Strike (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators can make a studied strike as a free action against their studied target, dealing additional precision damage that scales with level (1d6 to 9d6).

sections.title: Swift Alchemy (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators create alchemical items in half the normal time and can apply poison to weapons as a move action instead of a standard action.

sections.title: True Inspiration (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: Investigators can use inspiration on all checks without spending uses and roll 2d6 instead of 1d6 when expending inspiration.

sections.title: Deadly Study (Ex) (Investigator)
sections.description: The investigator's studied combat bonus increases by 4 and studied strike damage increases by 3d6, representing mastery of combat analysis.
